articles.headline: Obama Urges Speed on Immigration Plan, but Exposes Conflicts
articles.snippet: Criticism from a Republican leader suggests that reaching consensus on immigration law remains difficult despite a new bipartisan push since the November elections.
articles.abstract: Criticism from a Republican leader suggests that reaching consensus on immigration law remains difficult despite a new bipartisan push since the November elections.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Seizing an opening to rewrite the nation’s immigration laws, President Obama challenged Congress on Tuesday to act swiftly to put 11 million illegal immigrants living in the United States on a clear path to citizenship.

articles.headline: Analysts See the Good in Amazon’s Poor Results
articles.snippet: Amazon missed expectations on both revenue and profit, but an increase in its operating margin — to 3.2 percent from 2.7 percent — caught investors’ attention.
articles.abstract: Amazon missed expectations on both revenue and profit, but an increase in its operating margin — to 3.2 percent from 2.7 percent — caught investors’ attention.
articles.lead_paragraph: A glorious future beats a glorious past.

articles.headline: Under Fire, Chesapeake Co-Founder to Depart
articles.snippet: Chesapeake Energy, the oil and natural gas producer, says its co-founder and chief executive, Aubrey K. McClendon, will retire on April 1, almost eight months after investors complained about a compensation plan.
articles.abstract: Chesapeake Energy, the oil and natural gas producer, says its co-founder and chief executive, Aubrey K. McClendon, will retire on April 1, almost eight months after investors complained about a compensation plan.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: BlackBerry 10 Critical to Research in Motion
articles.snippet: The long-awaited smartphone has been designed to retain, and bring back, the corporate users that once propelled the BlackBerry maker to success.
articles.abstract: The long-awaited smartphone has been designed to retain, and bring back, the corporate users that once propelled the BlackBerry maker to success.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — Research in Motion’s introduction on Wednesday of a new BlackBerry phone will be the most important event in the company’s history since 1996, when its founders showed investors a small block of wood and promised that a wireless e-mail device shaped like that would change business forever.

articles.headline: In Energy Taxes, Tools to Help Tackle Climate Change
articles.snippet: Americans may have grown more aware of the potential risks of climate change, but they are no more willing to bear the costs of trying to solve the problem.
articles.abstract: Americans may have grown more aware of the potential risks of climate change, but they are no more willing to bear the costs of trying to solve the problem.
articles.lead_paragraph: To understand the complicated politics of climate change in the United States, you may want to talk to Pamela Johnson, president of the National Corn Growers Association’s Corn Board.

articles.headline: MF Global’s Bankruptcy Nears a Happy Conclusion
articles.snippet: The push to make MF Global customers nearly whole, a goal now surprisingly within reach, is a remarkable turnaround for the brokerage firm.
articles.abstract: The push to make MF Global customers nearly whole, a goal now surprisingly within reach, is a remarkable turnaround for the brokerage firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Mahesh Desai checked his MF Global account 15 months ago, his $580,000 nest egg was gone.

articles.headline: Boeing 787 Battery Was a Concern Before Failure
articles.snippet: Even before battery failures led to the grounding of all Boeing 787 jets, there were problems that raised questions about their reliability.
articles.abstract: Even before battery failures led to the grounding of all Boeing 787 jets, there were problems that raised questions about their reliability.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even before two battery failures led to the grounding of all Boeing 787 jets this month, the lithium-ion batteries used on the aircraft had experienced multiple problems that raised questions about their reliability.
articles.byline: By Christopher Drew, Hiroko Tabuchi and Jad Mouawad

articles.headline: Strict Gun Laws in Chicago Can’t Stem Fatal Shots
articles.snippet: The city’s experience has revealed the complications inherent in carrying out local gun laws around the United States.
articles.abstract: The city’s experience has revealed the complications inherent in carrying out local gun laws around the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Not a single gun shop can be found in this city because they are outlawed. Handguns were banned in Chicago for decades, too, until 2010, when the United States Supreme Court ruled that was going too far, leading city leaders to settle for restrictions some describe as the closest they could get legally to a ban without a ban. Despite a continuing legal fight, Illinois remains the only state in the nation with no provision to let private citizens carry guns in public.

articles.headline: U.S. Growth Halted as Federal Spending Fell in 4th Quarter
articles.snippet: The government played a role in slowing the economic recovery as cuts in military spending and other factors overwhelmed the Federal Reserve’s expanded campaign to spur growth.
articles.abstract: The government played a role in slowing the economic recovery as cuts in military spending and other factors overwhelmed the Federal Reserve’s expanded campaign to spur growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: The federal government helped bring the economic recovery to a virtual halt late last year as cuts in military spending and other factors overwhelmed the Federal Reserve’s expanded campaign to stimulate growth.
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Binyamin Appelbaum

articles.headline: Boeing Says No Change in Batteries Is Planned
articles.snippet: W. James McNerney Jr. defended the use of lithium-ion batteries in the Dreamliner planes, as the company reported higher quarterly earnings.
articles.abstract: W. James McNerney Jr. defended the use of lithium-ion batteries in the Dreamliner planes, as the company reported higher quarterly earnings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Despite two serious safety failures and new questions about the reliability of its lithium-ion batteries, Boeing’s chief executive said Wednesday that he saw no reason to retreat from using the new but volatile technology on its 787 jets.

articles.headline: BlackBerry, Rebuilt, Lives to Fight Another Day
articles.snippet: The new BlackBerry Z10 is lovely, fast and efficient, bristling with fresh and useful ideas.
articles.abstract: The new BlackBerry Z10 is lovely, fast and efficient, bristling with fresh and useful ideas.
